pkgmetadata.longdescription:
Policycoreutils contains the policy core utilities that are required for basic operation of a SELinux system. These utilities include load_policy to load policies, setfiles to label filesystems, newrole to switch roles, and run_init to run /etc/init.d scripts in the proper context.
Gentoo-specific tools include rlpkg for relabeling packages by name, avc_toggle to toggle between enforcing and permissive modes, and avc_enforcing to query the current mode of the system, enforcing or permissive.

use.flag: Enable support for sys-process/audit and use the audit_* functions (like audit_getuid instead of getuid())
